content.raw: I can't speak for this feature in particular whether or not it should be recommended that this should be set to a nonzero value for all segway runs. Perhaps this should be omitted for now. @hoffman any thoughts?
content.html: I can't speak for this feature in particular whether or not it should be recommended that this should be set to a nonzero value for all segway runs. Perhaps this should be omitted for now. @hoffman any thoughts?

content.raw: Yes, there is no division associated with **TRANSITION_PRIOR_STRENGTH** or ** transition_seg_strength**, which assigns to equal **TRANSITION_PRIOR_STRENGTH**.
content.html: Yes, there is no division associated with TRANSITION_PRIOR_STRENGTH or transition_seg_strength, which assigns to equal TRANSITION_PRIOR_STRENGTH.

content.raw: Yes, it seems that "seg_seg" is used twice in the input_master.py file. I would change it to a constatnt.
content.html: Yes, it seems that "seg_seg" is used twice in the input_master.py file. I would change it to a constatnt.

content.raw: Got it.
content.html: Got it.

content.raw: I'm not certain where this ends up, but naming this 'prior' and having it set to 0 makes me super cautious about this potentially being a divide by zero issue. I assume that this is impossible correct?
content.html: I'm not certain where this ends up, but naming this 'prior' and having it set to 0 makes me super cautious about this potentially being a divide by zero issue. I assume that this is impossible correct?

content.raw: There really should be better names for these conditionals to avoid confusion. `transition_seg_strength` and `len_seg_strength` are very similar and somwhat confusing in this context. At the very least put a comment before each conditional stating why each table spec is being chosen.
content.html: There really should be better names for these conditionals to avoid confusion. transition_seg_strength and len_seg_strength are very similar and somwhat confusing in this context. At the very least put a comment before each conditional stating why each table spec is being chosen.

content.raw:
@Shiqi_Zou I've done a preliminary review below. Please update the documentation in docs/segway.rst for why/when you would use this particular feature. Please also update the NEWS file with your feature.

Thanks!
content.html:
@Shiqi_Zou I've done a preliminary review below. Please update the documentation in docs/segway.rst for why/when you would use this particular feature. Please also update the NEWS file with your feature.

Thanks!

content.html: I think flake8 would complain about alignment here.

content.raw: thank you for pointing it out.   :)
content.html: thank you for pointing it out. :)

content.raw: sure, I would add the comment before each condition
content.html: sure, I would add the comment before each condition

content.raw: These are not aligned. I'm fairly certain flake8 would complain here.
content.html: These are not aligned. I'm fairly certain flake8 would complain here.

content.raw: Is "seg_seg" a constant somewhere? `NAME_SEGCOUNTDOWN_SEG_SEGTRANSITION` implies there's a constant name for the previous condition.
content.html: Is "seg_seg" a constant somewhere? NAME_SEGCOUNTDOWN_SEG_SEGTRANSITION implies there's a constant name for the previous condition.

content.raw: Put the conditionals on separate lines and eliminate the brackets. Put brackets only around the entire conditional when split across lines.
content.html: Put the conditionals on separate lines and eliminate the brackets. Put brackets only around the entire conditional when split across lines.

content.raw:
I thought --len-prior-strength is the update for --prior-strength.
Following Max, I would change the name back and add new option as --transition-prior-strength.
I will test it first, and push the updated version as soon as possible.
Sorry I am not familiar with hg, I will do "hg merge" later. Thank you for pointing out.
content.html: I thought --len-prior-strength is the update for --prior-strength. Following Max, I would change the name back and add new option as --transition-prior-strength. I will test it first, and push the updated version as soon as possible. Sorry I am not familiar with hg, I will do "hg merge" later. Thank you for pointing out.

content.raw:
Ok, then I need to change the argument name back and create a new option name called --transition-prior-strength.
Correct me if I misunderstand.
content.html: Ok, then I need to change the argument name back and create a new option name called --transition-prior-strength. Correct me if I misunderstand.

content.raw: The --transition-prior-strength adds pseudocounts to the label-label transition matrix. I had originally named the old parameter as --len-prior-strength to distinguish it from --transition-prior-strength, but you're right that doing so breaks old scripts. Shiqi, could you change the argument name back?
content.html: The --transition-prior-strength adds pseudocounts to the label-label transition matrix. I had originally named the old parameter as --len-prior-strength to distinguish it from --transition-prior-strength, but you're right that doing so breaks old scripts. Shiqi, could you change the argument name back?

content.raw:
Can you describe this pull request better? You've changed the --prior-strength option to --len-prior-strength and altered it's behavior? 

Why would you remove the previous option? What is the intent of these changes?

In general thought it is not the best idea to rename an existing option. This change would break existing Segway scripts and setups.

Also it would be great when you merge changes to use the 'hg merge' command. In your commits there is no record of what changesets you were actually merging so I assume that this was some sort of manual merge that took place. Please merge with the head of the default branch.
content.html:
Can you describe this pull request better? You've changed the --prior-strength option to --len-prior-strength and altered it's behavior?

Why would you remove the previous option? What is the intent of these changes?

In general thought it is not the best idea to rename an existing option. This change would break existing Segway scripts and setups.

Also it would be great when you merge changes to use the 'hg merge' command. In your commits there is no record of what changesets you were actually merging so I assume that this was some sort of manual merge that took place. Please merge with the head of the default branch.
